chargeHist.descr: 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13

result.execSummary:
The defendant Marquile K Latson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Attempt Attempt 3rd Degree Sexual Assault, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: To any other sentence, with credit for 4 days time served.
Extended Supervision and Probation conditions the same except for condition time.

miscConds.notes:
Court ordered to pay restitution in the sum of $10.00 to Crime Victim Compensation Fund, joint and several with Jermaine Strotter. Any additional restitution to be determined. Restitution is to be collected by the DOC from 25% or prison funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b), Wis Stats. and during extended supervision. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Case adjourned for restitution hearing in Branch 10 on February 4, 2015.
***2-4-2015, Judge Dugan, Restitution hearing: Court ordered the sum of $568.09 to victim, A.M., joint and several with Jermaine Strotter.***

Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample and imposed mandatory surcharges.
Defendant to pay a DNA surcharge and all other costs and any other surcharges during probation and/or by the Department of Corrections from 25% of prison funds and to convert to a civil judgment upon release to/from extended supervision or successful completion of probation.

Seek and maintain full time employment if not in school.
Vocational/education training.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may not possess any firearms and body armor.
No contact with A.M., her family, her residence and school.

Cognitive Behavior Therapy.
Sex offender assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
Pursuant to 973.048, defendant to comply with the reporting requirements under 301.45 for the sex offender registry with DOC.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights are restored.

Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any recommended treatment deemed necessary by the department.
Random urine screens.

timeConds.notes: No good time credit. Court stayed the sentence to be used as sanctions. Court ordered defendant to serve 30 days STRAIGHT time for 1st violation; 45 days STRAIGHT time for 2nd violation and balance as STRAIGHT time for 3rd violation.

Filed, JusticePoint Pretrial Report.
jad

Defendant Marquile K Latson in court with attorney Michael L. Chernin.  Jesica Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by counsel and defendant.  Additional statements made by Keisha M.
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 5 YEARS, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 4 days time served.; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2.5 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2.5 YEARS with the following conditions:
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Sex offender assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*No contact with A.M., her family, residence and school
*Random urine screens. 
*Seek and maintain  fulltime employment if not in school.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy
*Vocational/educational training
The court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for a period of 30 months with the following conditions:
*Defendant to serve 12 months in the House of Correction.  No good time credit.  Court stayed sentence to be used as sanctions.  Court ordered defendant to serve 30 days STRAIGHT time for 1st violation; 45 days STRAIGHT time for 2nd violation and balance as STRAIGHT time for 3rd violation.
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Sex offender assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*No contact with A.M., her family, residence and school
*Random urine screens. 
*Seek and maintain  fulltime employment if not in school.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy
*Vocational/educational training

Pursuant to 973.048, defendant to comply with the reporting requirements under 301.45 for the sex offender registry with DOC.  

Court ordered defendant to provide DNA sample and imposed mandatory surcharges.
Defendant to pay a DNA SURCHARGE and all other costs and any other surcharges during probation and/or by the Department of Corrections from 25% of prison funds and to convert to civil judgment upon release to/from extended supervision or successful completion of probation.

Court ordered to pay restitution in the sum of $10.00 to Crime Victim  Compensation Fund joint and serveral with Jermaine Strotter.  Any additional restitution to be determined.  Restitution is to be collected by the DOC from 25% of prison funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b), Wis. Stats. an during extended supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Case adjourned for restitution hearing in Branch 10.

Defendant's motion to expunge denied by the court.

Court informed defendant he is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program or Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may not possess any firearms and body armor.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until civil rights are restored.

Filed,

-Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgment;
jad  Restitution hearing scheduled for February 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Marquile K Latson in court.  Jesica Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Attorney Chernin is ill today and cannot appear.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Marquile K Latson in court with attorney Michael L. Chernin.  Jesica Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defense moves for an adjournment.  Defendant is to have treatment, but has not been able to obtain insurance to begin treatment.  Court grants motion to adjourn.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 18, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Victim Impact Statement and Restitution Request worksheet received and filed./ds
Received and filed with court.

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found Defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.   Court ordered case adjourned for Sentencing in Branch 44.

As a convicted felon Defendant shall NEVER be in possession of any firearms or weapons.
Defendant shall not vote until civil rights are restored.

Defendant Marquile K Latson in court with attorney Michael L. Chernin.  Paul L. Tiffin appeared for Sara B. Lewis for the State of Wisconsin. On motion of the State Court AMENDED Count 1 from 1st Degree Sexual Assault of a Child  TO  Attempt Third Degree Sexual Assault under Wisconsin Stats. 940.225(3), 939.50(3)(g), and 939.32 a Class G Felony.
Amended Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Parties are prepared to proceed with a Projected Guilty Plea.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 17, 2014 at 10:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Marquile K Latson in court with attorney Michael L. Chernin.  Sara B. Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defendant will accept the State's offer, but needs to do some things before that can be accomplished.  Court cancels the jury trial.  Plea hearing scheduled for August 22, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point report received and filed./ds

Defendant Marquile K Latson in court with attorney Michael L. Chernin.  Sara B. Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk kmh.
Case scheduled for a final pretrial.  Parties are negotiating and believe this matter will be resolved.  Court advised the parties Br 44 will be taking over this matter as of August 1, 2014.  Parties are to either have plea forms completed and ready to plea on the next court date or be prepared to complete a final pretrial.  Case remains scheduled for jury trial on 8/11/2014 at 9:00 a.m.   Case is adjourned to Br 44.  Final pre-trial scheduled for 08-05-2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Marquile K Latson in court with attorney Michael L. Chernin.  Sara B. Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Branch 12, Judge David Borowski presiding.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 15, 2014 at 08:30 am.

css

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision. 
The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with A.M. her family, and all children under 16. 
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Marquile K Latson in court with attorney Megan L. Morrisey.  Defendant Marquile K Latson in custody.  Carole R. Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Borowski, Branch 12.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a Preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.   DEFENDANT QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION. ADA Manchester approved quick date.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 9, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
